description:
From Latin haesitatus, past participle of haesitare, intensive of haerere (“to hesitate, stick fast;
to hang or hold fast”). Displaced native Old English wandian.

verbs.description: hesitate (third-person singular simple present hesitates, present participle hesitating, simple past and past participle hesitated)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To stop or pause respecting decision or action; to be in suspense or uncertainty as to a determination.
examples: He hesitated whether to accept the offer or not; men often hesitate in forming a judgment.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To stammer; to falter in speaking.
(transitive, poetic, rare) To utter with hesitation or to intimate by a reluctant manner.
examples: Just hint a fault, and hesitate dislike.
